question: An archaeological site named Pompeii, which was making news recently, is located in which country?
explanation:
Archaeologists have discovered a 2000-year-old food and drinks shop in the site of Pompeii, the site which was buried in a volcanic eruption in 79 AD.
They have also found traces of food in some of the deep terra cotta jars containing hot food in the shop known as termopolium (Latin for hot drinks counter). It was discovered in the archaeological parkâ€™s Regio V site, near the coast of Bay of Naples, in Italy.
